poem:
### The Missed Opportunity

In Paris, words fell,  
like leaves from a forgotten tree,  
whispered hopes of safety—  
loose threads in the jetstream  
of progress. Silence reigned,  
a metallic echo in lofty halls;  
yet in absence,  
truth's quiet voice rises,  
a plea unspoken:  
guardians of tomorrow,  
wake swiftly from your dreaming.
